translated: by which the asuras, frightened, terrified, anxious and agitated, flee.

translated: But, Manjushri, that great Dharma drum has no one who sets it up or an embodied form.

analyzed: deva putrāṇām sarva upadrava upāyāsa upakleśa upaśāntaye samvarttate
translated: to pacify all harm, misfortune, afflictions, and troubles of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: yathā mañjuśrīḥ tasyāḥ mahādundubheḥ
translated: Just as, Mañjuśrī, from that great drum,

original: sa ca dharmaśabda trayastriṃśatkāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ sarvopadravopāyāsopakleśopaśāntaye samvarttate /

translated: And that sound of the Dharma serves to pacify all harm, misfortune, afflictions, and troubles of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīs tathāgato rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ /

translated: And that sound of the Dharma serves to pacify all the calamities, troubles, afflictions, and illnesses of all beings.

translated: The sound emerges in order to generate all forms of happiness for all beings and to inspire the heedless.

analyzed: te mañjuśrī satvāḥ śabdam śrutvā tathāgatan saṃṅkalpayanti
translated: Those beings, Mañjuśrī, having heard the sound, conceive of the Tathāgata.

translated: And in order to generate the roots of virtue in the Tathāgata for beginners in the bodhisattva path and all foolish ordinary beings, the speech of the Tathāgata is heard.

original: api tv anutpanno 'niruddho maṃjuśrīḥ tathāgato veditavyaḥ //
analyzed: api tu anutpannaḥ niruddhaḥ maṃjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: However, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata should be known as unborn and unceasing.

translated: Just as, Mañjuśrī, at the end of the hot season, when the first month of the rains has arrived, by the ripening of the previous karma of beings, in the sky above, in the space of the sky, there blow such winds as cause water to form.

translated: at that time all the beings in Jambūdvīpa think like this: 'Here a cloud does not arise.'

translated: up to the class of gods of the Four Great Kings.

original: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena tasya mahābrahmaṇo daśatrisāhasramahāsāhasravaśavarttinaḥ sarvvadevānikāyāṃ vyavalokayataḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ samayena tasya mahābrahmaṇaḥ daśa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra vaśavarttinaḥ sarvva devānikāyām vyavalokayataḥ
translated: At that time, Mañjuśrī, when the Great Brahmā, the Lord of the trichiliocosm, looks upon all the classes of gods,

original: sarvvadevanikāyeṣu sarvvadevaputrāḥ svakasvakāṇ kāmakrīḍāratiparibhogāṃ tyaktvā sarvvatūryatāḍāvacarasaṃgītiṃ śamayitvā kāmakrīḍāratimanasikārotsṛṣtāḥ
analyzed: sarvva deva nikāyeṣu sarvva deva putrāḥ svaka svakān kāma krīḍā rati paribhogām tyaktvā sarvva tūrya tāḍāva cara saṃgītim śamayitvā kāma krīḍā rati manasikāra utsṛṣtāḥ
translated: in all the classes of gods, all the sons of gods, having abandoned their own sensual enjoyments, amusements, pleasures, and experiences, having stilled all the music of musical instruments and songs, having let go of thoughts of sensual enjoyments, amusements, and pleasures,

analyzed: sa gauravāḥ
translated: with reverence,🔽and with a mind full of faith, they all look upon the face of the Great Brahmā.

analyzed: añjalim pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣam vyavalokayanti
translated: They join their palms in reverence and gaze unblinking at Great Brahmā.

original: sa ca mahābrahmā sarvvadevanikāyeṣu muhūrttan darśanaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: sa ca mahābrahmā sarvva deva nikāyeṣu muhūrttan darśanam dadāti
translated: And that Great Brahmā grants an audience to all the classes of gods for a moment.

original: te ca devaputrās tasmin samaye mahābrahmaloko papattim ākāṃkṣaṃti /
analyzed: te ca deva putrāḥ tasmin samaye mahābrahma loka upapattim ākāṃkṣaṃti
translated: And at that time, those gods desire rebirth in the realm of Great Brahmā.

analyzed: mahābrahma loka upapattaye ca kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayanti
translated: And they dedicate their roots of goodness to rebirth in the realm of Great Brahmā.

original: sa ca mañjuśrīr mahābrahmācyavamāno tato brahmavimānād anyam adhitiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa ca mañjuśrīḥ mahābrahmā acyavamānaḥ tatas brahmavimānāt anyam adhitiṣṭhati
translated: And that Great Brahmā, as he is passing away, establishes himself in another [realm],

original: mahābrahmāṇaṃ daśatrisāhasramahāsāhasravaśavarttinaṃ pūrvvapraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānena teṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇāṃ pūrvvakuśalamūlopacayena sa ca mañjuśrīr nirmitor mahābrahmā divase divase sarvvadevanikāyāṃ vyavalokayati /
analyzed: mahābrahmāṇam daśa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasra vaśavartinam pūrvva praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānena teṣām ca devaputrāṇām pūrvva kuśala mūla upacayena sa ca mañjuśrīḥ mahābrahmā divase divase sarvva deva nikāyām vyavalokayati
translated: the Great Brahmā who rules over the ten trichiliocosms, by the power of his previous aspirations and by the accumulation of previous roots of goodness of those gods. And that Great Brahmā, the magical creation, Mañjuśrī, looks upon all the classes of gods day after day.

original: yāvac cāturmahārājakāyikadevanikāyāṃ tena khalu punar maṃjuśrīḥ svamayena sarvveṣu devanikāyeṣu sarvvadevaputrāḥ svakasvakāṃ kāmaṃkrīḍāratiparibhogāṃ tyaktvā sarvvatūryatāḍāvacarasaṅgītiḥ praśamayitvā kāmakrīḍāratima sikārotsṛṣṭāḥ sagauravāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat cāturmahārājakāyika devanikāyām tena khalu punar maṃjuśrīḥ sva mayena sarveṣu devanikāyeṣu sarva deva putrāḥ svaka svakām kāmaṃkrīḍā rati paribhogām tyaktvā sarva tūrya tāḍāva cara saṅgītiḥ praśamayitvā kāma krīḍā rati ma sikāra utsṛṣṭāḥ sa gauravāḥ
translated: And as far as the realm of the Four Great Kings of the gods, Mañjuśrī, by that self-nature of his, in all the realms of the gods, all the sons of the gods, having abandoned their own sensual enjoyments, amusements, and delights, having stilled all the music and songs, having given up sensual enjoyments, amusements, and delights, with reverence,

original: añjaliṃ pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣaṃ vyavalokayaṃti sma /
analyzed: añjalim pragṛhya mahābrahmāṇam animiṣam vyavalokayaṃti sma
translated: they took up their palms in reverence and gazed unblinking at Great Brahmā.

original: sa ca mahābrahmā sarvadevanikāyeṣu muhūrttan darśanaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: sa ca mahābrahmā sarva deva nikāyeṣu muhūrttan darśanam dadāti
translated: And that Great Brahmā gives a glimpse in all the realms of the gods for a moment.

analyzed: na ca sthānāt calati
translated: And he does not move from his place.

original: te ca devaputrās tasmin samaye mahābrahmalokapapattim ākāṅkṣanti /
analyzed: te ca deva putrāḥ tasmin samaye mahābrahma loka papattim ākāṅkṣanti
translated: And at that time, those sons of the gods long for rebirth in the world of Great Brahmā.

analyzed: brahma loka upapattaye ca kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayanti
translated: And they dedicate their roots of goodness for rebirth in the world of Brahmā.

analyzed: na ca atra mañjuśrī brahmā saṃcidyate
translated: But, Mañjuśrī, Brahmā is not destroyed here.

original: śūnyo yaṃ mañjuśrīr brahmā vaśiko 'bhūto 'nakṣaro 'ghoṣo 'deśo ' bhāvo 'cintyo 'nimittaś cittamanovijñānāpagato 'nutpanno ' niruddhaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyaḥ yam mañjuśrīḥ brahmā vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ bhāvo cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ nu tpannaḥ niruddhaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, Brahmā is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters, without sound, without place, without essence, inconceivable, signless, devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness, unborn, and unceasing.

original: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ sarvvadevanikāyeṣu darśanābhāso bhavati /
analyzed: atha ca mañjuśrīḥ sarvva deva nikāyeṣu darśana ābhāsaḥ bhavati
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, he appears in the assemblies of all the gods.

original: tasyaiva mahābrahmaṇaḥ pūrvvakuśalamūlapraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānena teṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇāṃ pūrvvakuśalamūlopacayena /
analyzed: tasya eva mahābrahmaṇaḥ pūrvva kuśala mūla praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānena teṣām ca devaputrāṇām pūrvva kuśala mūla upacayena
translated: This is by the power of the previous wholesome roots and vows of that Great Brahmā himself, and by the previous accumulation of wholesome roots by those gods.

original: na ca mañjuśrīs teṣān devaputrāṇāṃ evaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na ca mañjuśrīḥ teṣām deva putrāṇām evam bhavati
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, those gods do not think:

analyzed: nirmitaḥ yam brahmā
translated: Brahmā is an emanation.

analyzed: śūnyaḥ vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ
translated: He is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters,🔽without sound, without a country, non-existent, inconceivable, signless,

analyzed: aghoṣaḥ deśaḥ cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ
translated: free from mind, thought, and consciousness,

analyzed: an utpannaḥ niruddhaḥ vā iti
translated: unborn, unceasing.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīs tathāgato py arhan samyaksambuddhaḥ śūnyo 'vaśiko 'bhūto 'nakṣaro 'ghoṣo 'deśo 'bhāvo'cintyo 'nimittaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ pi arhan samyaksambuddhaḥ śūnyaḥ vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ bhāva ucintyaḥ nimittaḥ
translated: In just the same way, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters, without sound, without a country, non-existent, inconceivable, signless,

analyzed: citta manaḥ vijñāna apagataḥ
translated: free from mind, thought, and consciousness,

analyzed: anutpannaḥ niruddhaḥ
translated: unborn, unceasing.

original: atha ca punar mañjuśrīs tathāgato rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ /
analyzed: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One

original: pūrvvabodhisatvacaryāpraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānena ādikarmiṇāñ ca bodhisatvānāṃ sarvvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ ca sarvabālapṛthagjanānāṃ sarvakuśalamūlādhiṣṭhānena lakṣaṇaśatasahasrālaṃkṛtas tathāgataḥ pratibimbam iva loke saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: pūrvva bodhisatva caryā praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhānena ādi karmiṇām ca bodhisatvānām sarvva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāna saṃprasthitānām ca sarva bāla pṛthagjanānām sarva kuśala mūla adhiṣṭhānena lakṣaṇa śata sahasra alaṃkṛtaḥ tathāgataḥ pratibimbam iva loke saṃdṛśyate
translated: By the power of his former vows to practice the conduct of a bodhisattva, and by the power of the roots of virtue of all beginners in the bodhisattva path, of all those who have set out in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and of all foolish ordinary beings, the Tathagata, adorned with a hundred thousand marks, appears in the world like a reflection.

analyzed: na ca sthānāt calati
translated: But he does not move from his place.

original: na ca mañjuśrīr ādikarmikāṇāñ ca bodhisatvānāṃ sarvvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhayānikānāṃ sarvvabālapṛthagjanānāñ caivam bhavati /
analyzed: na ca mañjuśrīḥ ādi karmikāṇām ca bodhisatvānām sarvva śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikānām sarvva bāla pṛthagjanānām ca evam bhavati
translated: And, Manjushri, beginners in the bodhisattva path, all those in the vehicles of hearers and solitary buddhas, and all foolish ordinary beings think:

analyzed: śūnyaḥ tathāgata vaśikaḥ bhūtaḥ nakṣaraḥ ghoṣaḥ deśaḥ cintyaḥ nimittaḥ citta manaḥ vijñanā apagataḥ
translated: The Tathagata is empty, insubstantial, unreal, without letters, without sound, without place, non-existent, inconceivable, signless, devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness.

analyzed: an utpannaḥ niruddhaḥ ca iti
translated: He is unborn and unceasing.

original: atha ca mañjuśrī tathāgatātmabhāvāl lakṣaṇaśatasahasrālaṃkṛtāt sarvvatathāgateryāpatheṣu śūnyeṣu nānāvidhivicitrāḥ nānādhimuktānāṃ satvānām mahādharmadeśanā niścarati /
analyzed: atha ca mañjuśrī tathāgata ātmabhāvāt lakṣaṇa śata sahasra alaṃkṛtāt sarvva tathāgata īryāpatheṣu śūnyeṣu nānā vidhi vicitrāḥ nānā adhimuktānām satvānām mahā dharma deśanā niścarati
translated: And yet, Manjushri, from the Tathagata's body, adorned with a hundred thousand marks, in all the Tathagata's activities, which are empty, great Dharma teachings issue forth in various ways for beings with various inclinations.

original: sā ca dharmadeśanā sarvvasatvānāṃ sarvopadravopāyāsokleśopa śāntaye samvarttate /
analyzed: sā ca dharma deśanā sarvva satvānām sarva upadrava upāyāsa ukleśa upa śāntaye samvarttate
translated: And that teaching of the Dharma occurs for the pacification of all harm, calamity, and suffering of all beings.

original: tatra ca tathāgataḥ samayaḥ sarvvatro pekṣako nirvikalpo nnirvviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca tathāgataḥ samayaḥ sarvatra u pekṣakaḥ nirvikalpaḥ nirviśeṣaḥ
translated: And there, the Tathāgata is impartial, free from conceptualization, and without distinction.

original: tad anenāpi te mañjuśrīḥ paryāyeṇaivam veditavyaṃ /
analyzed: tat anena api te mañjuśrīḥ paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: By this method also, Mañjuśrī, it should be known thus:

analyzed: anutpādaḥ nirodhaḥ iti
translated: Non-arising and non-cessation.

analyzed: tathāgatasya etat adhivacanam iti
translated: This is a designation for the Tathāgata.

original: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyāṃm imā gāthe abhāṣat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imā gāthe abhāṣat
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses at that time:

analyzed: anutpāda dharmāḥ satatam tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is always of the nature of non-arising,

analyzed: sarvve ca dharmāḥ sugatena sādṛśāḥ
translated: And all dharmas are similar to the Sugata.

analyzed: nimitta grāheṇa tu bāla buddhayaḥ
translated: But those of childish understanding, through grasping at signs,

analyzed: asatsu dharmeṣu caranti loke
translated: Wander in the world in non-existent dharmas.

analyzed: tathāgataḥ hi pratibimba bhūtaḥ
translated: For the Tathāgata is a reflection

analyzed: kuśalasya dharmasya anāśravasya
translated: Of wholesome, uncontaminated dharmas.

analyzed: na ca atra tathatā na tathāgataḥ usti
translated: And here, there is no suchness, nor is there a Tathāgata.

analyzed: bimbām ca saṃdṛśyati sarvvaloke
translated: But a reflection is seen in the whole world.

original: tadyathā mañjuśrīḥ sūryaraśmayo jambūdīpe pūrvvataram eva tāvan mahāśailendrarājānam avabhāsayanti tataḥ paścāc cakravāḍāna ma cakravāḍān avabhāsayanti /
analyzed: tat yathā mañjuśrīḥ sūrya raśmayaḥ jambūdīpe pūrvvataram eva tāvat mahā śaila indra rājānam avabhāsayanti tatas paścāt cakravāḍān ma cakravāḍān avabhāsayanti
translated: It is like this, Mañjuśrī: the sun's rays first illuminate the great kings of mountains in Jambudvīpa, then the Cakravāḍa and Mahācakravāḍa mountains,

analyzed: tatas paścāt ucca uccām pṛthivī pradeśān avabhāsayanti
translated: then the high and lofty regions of the earth,

original: tataḥ paścād iha jambūdvīpe nimnāṃ pṛthivīpradeśān avabhāsāyanti /
analyzed: tatas paścāt iha jambūdvīpe nimnām pṛthivī pradeśān avabhāsāyanti
translated: and then the low-lying regions of the earth in this Jambudvīpa.

original: te ca mañjuśrīḥ sūryaraśmayo na kalpayanti vikalpayanti /🔽na cintayanti /
analyzed: te ca mañjuśrīḥ sūrya raśmayaḥ na kalpayanti vikalpayanti  na cintayanti
translated: And those sun's rays, Mañjuśrī, do not conceptualize or discriminate,

analyzed: na vicintayanti
translated: do not think or reflect,

analyzed: citta manaḥ vijñāna apagatāḥ mañjuśrīḥ sūrya raśmayaḥ
translated: being devoid of mind, thought, and consciousness, Mañjuśrī.

analyzed: anutpanna aniruddhāḥ alakṣaṇāḥ alakṣaṇāḥ lakṣaṇa apagatāḥ
translated: They are unborn and unceasing, without characteristics, beyond characteristics,

analyzed: a manaskārāḥ manaskāra apagatāḥ aprapañcāḥ prapañca apagatāḥ
translated: without mental activity, beyond mental activity, non-proliferation, beyond proliferation,

analyzed: a parihārāḥ niḥ paridāhāḥ  na orasthāḥ na parasthāḥ
translated: without obstruction, beyond obstruction,🔽not on this side, not on the other side,

analyzed: na uccāḥ na nīcāḥ
translated: not high, not low,

analyzed: na baddhāḥ na muktāḥ
translated: not bound, not liberated,

original: na jñānavanto nājñānavanto na saṃkleśā na niḥkleśāḥ /
analyzed: na jñānavantaḥ na ajñānavantaḥ na saṃkleśāḥ na niḥkleśāḥ
translated: not possessing knowledge, not devoid of knowledge, not defiled, not undefiled,

analyzed: na satya vādinaḥ na mṛṣāvādinaḥ
translated: not speaking truthfully, not speaking falsely,

analyzed: na tīre na nimne
translated: Not on the bank, not in the lowlands.

analyzed: na sthale na oghe
translated: Not on dry land, not in the flood.

analyzed: na tarkkavacarāḥ na a tarkkavacarāḥ
translated: Not in the realm of reasoning, not in the realm beyond reasoning.

analyzed: na rūpiṇaḥ na a rūpiṇaḥ
translated: Not with form, not without form.

original: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ pṛthivyāṃ uccanīcamadhyaviśeṣeṇa hīnamadhyotkṛṣṭāvabhāsasya cchayā vaicitryaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ pṛthivyām ucca nīca madhya viśeṣeṇa hīna madhya utkṛṣṭa avabhāsasya chayā vaicitryam bhavati
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, on the earth there is a variety of light, high, low, and middling, with a variety of shadows.

original: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ tathāgato py arhan samyaksambuddhaḥ /
analyzed: evam eva mañjuśrīḥ tathāgataḥ pi arhan samyaksambuddhaḥ
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One

analyzed: an utpannaḥ niruddhaḥ lakṣaṇaḥ lakṣaṇa apagataḥ
translated: is unborn, unceasing, without characteristics, free from characteristics.

analyzed: amanaskāraḥ manaskāra apagataḥ
translated: Without mental activity, free from mental activity.

original: aprapañcaḥ prapañcāpagataḥ /🔽aparidāho niḥparidāhaḥ na orastho na pārasthaḥ /🔽na ucco na nīca /
analyzed: aprapañcaḥ prapañca apagataḥ  a paridāhaḥ niḥparidāhaḥ na ora sthaḥ na pāra sthaḥ  na uccaḥ na nīca
translated: Without conceptual proliferation, free from conceptual proliferation.🔽Without burning, free from burning, not on this shore, not on the other shore,🔽not high, not low.

analyzed: na baddhaḥ na muktaḥ
translated: Not bound, not liberated.

analyzed: na jñānavān na ajñānavān
translated: Not knowing, not unknowing.

analyzed: na saṃkleśaḥ na niḥkleśaḥ
translated: Not defiled, not undefiled.

original: na satyavādī na mṛṣāvādī /🔽na avāre na pāre na tīre nātīre /🔽na nimne nānimne /🔽na sthale nāsthale /
analyzed: na satya vādī na mṛṣāvādī  na avāre na pāre na tīre na a tīre  na nimne na a nimne  na sthale na a sthale
translated: Not speaking the truth, not speaking falsely.🔽Not on the shore, not on the other shore, not on the bank, not on the other bank.

analyzed: na oghe na anoghe
translated: Not in the lowlands, not in the uplands.🔽Not on dry land, not in the water.🔽Not in the flood, not in the absence of the flood.

analyzed: na sarvvajñe na asarvvajñaḥ  na tarkkaḥ na a tarkkaḥ
translated: Not omniscient, not not omniscient.🔽Not reasoning, not beyond reasoning.

analyzed: na cāraḥ na a prācāraḥ
translated: Not practice, not non-practice.

original: na samudācāro nāsamudācāraḥ /🔽na smṛtimān nāsmṛtimān na cetano na niścetanaḥ /
analyzed: na samudācāraḥ na asamudācāraḥ  na smṛtimān na a smṛtimān na cetanaḥ na niścetanaḥ
translated: He is neither active nor inactive.🔽He is neither mindful nor unmindful, neither conscious nor unconscious.

original: na mano nāmano na nirjāto nānirjātaḥ /
analyzed: na manaḥ na amanaḥ na nirjātaḥ na a nirjātaḥ
translated: He is neither a mind nor not a mind, neither born nor unborn.

analyzed: na nāmaḥ na anāmaḥ
translated: He is neither a name nor not a name.

analyzed: na rūpaḥ na arūpaḥ  na vyāhāraḥ na a vyāhāraḥ
translated: He is neither form nor formless.🔽He is neither speech nor not speech.

analyzed: na prajñapyaḥ na a prajñapyaḥ
translated: He is neither to be designated nor not to be designated.

analyzed: na dṛśyaḥ na a dṛśyaḥ  na netrī
translated: He is neither visible nor invisible.

analyzed: na a netrī
translated: He is neither a leader nor not a leader.

original: na mārgapraṇetā nāmārgapraṇetā na prāptaphalo nāprāptaphalaḥ /
analyzed: na mārga praṇetā na amārga praṇetā na prāpta phalaḥ na a prāpta phalaḥ
translated: He is neither a path-maker nor not a path-maker, neither one who has attained the fruits nor one who has not attained the fruits.

analyzed: na kalpaḥ na akalpaḥ
translated: He is neither a kalpa nor not a kalpa.

analyzed: na kalpa apagataḥ na akalpa apagataḥ
translated: He is neither free from kalpas nor not free from kalpas.

analyzed: atha ca punar mañjuśrīḥ tathāgata sūrya maṇḍala jñānā raśmayaḥ
translated: And yet, Mañjuśrī, the rays of knowledge from the sun-disk of the Tathāgata

analyzed: traidhātuke ananta madhya dharmadhātu a pratihata raśmi avabhāsa pramuktāḥ prasṛtāḥ ca na raśmayaḥ
translated: Emit light that is unobstructed in the endless and boundless dharma-element of the three realms, and the rays spread out.

original: pūrvvataram eva mahāśailendrakalpādhyāśayānāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ kāye nipatanti /
analyzed: pūrvvataram eva mahā śailendra kalpa adhyāśayānām bodhisatvānām kāye nipatanti
translated: First, they fall on the bodies of bodhisattvas whose superior intention is like a great mountain king.

analyzed: tatas paścāt pratyekabuddha yāna saṃprasthitānām kāye nipatanti
translated: After that, they fall on the bodies of those who have set out in the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: tatas paścāt śrāvaka yāna saṃprasthitānām kāye nipatanti
